intro: Stichorkis mucronata, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a small, deciduous shrub native to southern Africa, characterized by its smooth, grayish bark and simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in cyathia, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Its latex sap is milky and can be toxic, which is a common feature among plants in this family. Stichorkis mucronata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and adaptability to various growing conditions.
